intro: Lippia schliebenii, commonly known as the yellow lippia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow or orange flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. Lippia schliebenii is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
